meanings.definition: The measurement of the absorption of electromagnetic radiation by matter.
meanings.sent1: Absorptiometry helps scientists understand how materials absorb light.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use absorptiometry to study how different substances absorb radiation.
meanings.sent3: During the science experiment, the absorptiometry machine went haywire and started beeping loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an absorptiometry device, absorbing every detail of the scene before her.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration made absorptiometry easy to grasp, as students watched the light disappear into the material.

meanings.definition: A technique used to measure the density of bone mineral.
meanings.sent1: Absorptiometry is commonly used in hospitals to check bone density.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended a bone absorptiometry test to assess the patient's bone health.
meanings.sent3: The skeleton at the museum joked that it needed an absorptiometry scan to see if it was getting weaker.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of bone health was as solid as a bone absorptiometry reading.
meanings.sent5: The machine hummed softly as it performed the bone absorptiometry, revealing the strength of the patient's bones.
